channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Meet the man who protects snowy owls that migrate to Boston's Logan Airport
item.description: Every year, snowy owls fly from the Arctic to Boston's Logan Airport to find food. One man catches them and releases them far away to keep the owls and passengers safe.

item.title: Trump signs executive actions to give automakers a break from some tariffs
item.description: Before a rally in Michigan on Tuesday, President Trump signed actions to give automakers a break from some tariffs. NPR speaks with Macomb County Chief Executive Mark Hackel about the reprieve.

item.title: What's changed between Trump's first and second terms in office
item.description: When President Trump took office in 2017, it was a shock to the political system. But his first term looks downright tame compared to the first 100 days of Trump 2.0.

item.title: Steve Bannon praises Trump's strategy, wants DOGE's receipts
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Trump ally Steve Bannon about the president's agenda at home and abroad.

item.title: The U.S. economy shrinks as Trump's tariffs spark recession fears
item.description: Trump promised a new "golden age" for the U.S. But his first 100 days in office have left the economy looking tarnished, with data showing the economy contracted in the first three months of the year.

item.title: Georgian filmmaker embedded in a birth clinic for a year to make abortion drama
item.description: Dea Kulumbegashvili embedded for a year inside a maternity clinic for her new film, April, about an obstetrician in rural Georgia, as the country faces increased abortion restrictions.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: A comparison of Trump's first and second terms, Trump ally Steve Bannon discusses the president's first 100 days back in office, GOP tries to advance Trump bill with top policy priorities.

item.title: House Republicans share details on federal student loan system overhaul
item.description: Republicans are proposing big changes to the federal student loan system, which would affect repayment plans, Pell Grants and a way to hold colleges accountable if students don't repay their loans.

item.title: Vietnamese celebrate 50th anniversary of end of the Vietnam War
item.description: People in Vietnam are celebrating the 50th anniversary of the end of the Vietnam War on Wednesday in Ho Chi Minh City, formerly known as Saigon.

item.title: Former NPR foreign editor recounts the fall of Saigon 50 years ago
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks with Loren Jenkins, former Newsweek reporter and former NPR foreign editor, about the fall of Saigon and what many consider the end of the Vietnam War 50 years ago.
